page.title: 04PITSCANDLY FARM
page.content: {Farming}is the main industry in this area. Three brothers own Pitscandly Farm. The farm was built in the 19th century but it has only been in their family since 1923. The farmers keep cattle, sheep and grow crops. There are 406 acres on the farm divided roughly into 12-14 acre fields which are on 6 year{rotation. }They grow barley, oats, turnips and processed peas for animals. It depends on the weather, but they usually sow the barley in the 3rd week of March and harvest it in mid September. They sell their{crops}in Kirriemuir. They have 24 Fresian cows crossed with Aberdeen Angus. The farmers have 200 {sheep}which stay out all year but have to come down during winter to avoid snow. Although the land is hilly, they have never had any problems farming it.
